verses.name: Psalms 78:1
verses.text: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 78:2
verses.text: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

verses.name: Psalms 78:3
verses.text: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

verses.name: Psalms 78:4
verses.text: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the Lord, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

verses.name: Psalms 78:5
verses.text: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

verses.name: Psalms 78:6
verses.text: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

verses.name: Psalms 78:7
verses.text: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

verses.name: Psalms 78:8
verses.text: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.

verses.name: Psalms 78:9
verses.text: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

verses.name: Psalms 78:10
verses.text: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

verses.name: Psalms 78:11
verses.text: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:12
verses.text: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

verses.name: Psalms 78:13
verses.text: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

verses.name: Psalms 78:14
verses.text: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

verses.name: Psalms 78:15
verses.text: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

verses.name: Psalms 78:16
verses.text: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 78:17
verses.text: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

verses.name: Psalms 78:18
verses.text: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

verses.name: Psalms 78:19
verses.text: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

verses.name: Psalms 78:20
verses.text: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

verses.name: Psalms 78:21
verses.text: Therefore the Lord heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

verses.name: Psalms 78:22
verses.text: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

verses.name: Psalms 78:23
verses.text: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

verses.name: Psalms 78:24
verses.text: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 78:25
verses.text: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.

verses.name: Psalms 78:26
verses.text: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

verses.name: Psalms 78:27
verses.text: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

verses.name: Psalms 78:28
verses.text: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

verses.name: Psalms 78:29
verses.text: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

verses.name: Psalms 78:30
verses.text: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,

verses.name: Psalms 78:31
verses.text: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 78:32
verses.text: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 78:33
verses.text: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 78:34
verses.text: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.

verses.name: Psalms 78:35
verses.text: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

verses.name: Psalms 78:36
verses.text: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

verses.name: Psalms 78:37
verses.text: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 78:38
verses.text: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 78:39
verses.text: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

verses.name: Psalms 78:40
verses.text: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

verses.name: Psalms 78:41
verses.text: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 78:42
verses.text: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 78:43
verses.text: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

verses.name: Psalms 78:44
verses.text: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

verses.name: Psalms 78:45
verses.text: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:46
verses.text: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

verses.name: Psalms 78:47
verses.text: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

verses.name: Psalms 78:48
verses.text: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

verses.name: Psalms 78:49
verses.text: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:50
verses.text: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

verses.name: Psalms 78:51
verses.text: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

verses.name: Psalms 78:52
verses.text: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.name: Psalms 78:53
verses.text: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 78:54
verses.text: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

verses.name: Psalms 78:55
verses.text: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.name: Psalms 78:56
verses.text: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

verses.name: Psalms 78:57
verses.text: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

verses.name: Psalms 78:58
verses.text: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

verses.name: Psalms 78:59
verses.text: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

verses.name: Psalms 78:60
verses.text: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

verses.name: Psalms 78:61
verses.text: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verses.name: Psalms 78:62
verses.text: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:63
verses.text: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

verses.name: Psalms 78:64
verses.text: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

verses.name: Psalms 78:65
verses.text: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

verses.name: Psalms 78:66
verses.text: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

verses.name: Psalms 78:67
verses.text: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

verses.name: Psalms 78:68
verses.text: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

verses.name: Psalms 78:69
verses.text: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 78:70
verses.text: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

verses.name: Psalms 78:71
verses.text: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:72
verses.text: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
